é‡‘å¥

  • â€œI'm convinced that this ultimately really empowers artists, right? It gives you new tools, right? It's like, hey, we now have, I don't know, watercolors for Michelangelo. Let's see what he does with it, right? And amazing things come out.â€
  • â€œTo me, I think that the most important thing for art is intent. And so what is generated from these models is a tool to allow people to create art.â€
  • â€œBut it really became kind of the best of both worlds in that sense, like the Gemini smartness and the multimodal kind of conversational nature of it, plus the visual quality of Imagine.â€
  • â€œBut I think humans get really bored fast of this type of thing. and now if you see an image that you know is just like, oh, that's just like a single prompt, person didn't think about it much. you can kind of tell like that's an AI-generated image, not that interesting.â€
  • â€œWe're in a lemon picking stage because every model can cherry pick images that look perfect. So like now I think the real question is like how expressible is this model and what's the worst image you would get given what you're trying to do.â€
